questions.question: A phishing attempt collects a user’s password. What happens if MFA is properly enforced?
choices: The system allows access but sends a warning
The attacker receives fake data instead
The attacker can't log in without the second factor
The password is auto-changed

questions.question: Which type of MFA is most resistant to phishing?
choices: Security questions
Email verification links
FIDO2 or WebAuthn hardware-based authenticators
SMS codes

questions.question: Which login flow design reduces the effectiveness of phishing, especially when paired with MFA?
choices: Only allowing login in incognito mode
Using device-based push notifications for verification
Disabling copy-paste on password fields
Hiding the login button until 5 seconds pass

questions.question: Your system uses email and password + SMS code for login. Which part is still vulnerable to phishing?
choices: The password is encrypted during login
The SMS code can be phished with real-time social engineering
The login form uses branding
The user’s email is protected

questions.question: Which of the following is a key reason MFA reduces phishing success rates?
choices: It hides the login form
It deletes suspicious emails
Stolen credentials are not enough to access the account
It shortens the login timeout

questions.question: If a user reports a phishing attempt but has MFA enabled, what should the security team do next?
choices: Disable MFA to avoid confusion
Ignore the report if MFA is active
Review access logs and educate the user, but the account is likely still secure
Reset all passwords in the system

questions.question: If a user reports a phishing attempt but has MFA enabled, what should the security team do next?
choices: Ignore the report if MFA is active
Disable MFA to avoid confusion
Review access logs and educate the user, but the account is likely still secure

choices: Reset all passwords in the system
Disable MFA to avoid confusion
Review access logs and educate the user, but the account is likely still secure
Ignore the report if MFA is active

questions.question: An employee accidentally enters their credentials on a fake login page. How does MFA help in this scenario?
choices: It prevents access unless the attacker also has the second authentication factor
It disables the user's account automatically
It instantly revokes all user sessions
It blocks phishing emails from loading

questions.question: Why is it important to encourage users not to approve unexpected MFA prompts?
choices: It slows down login systems
It could be a phishing attack trying to trick them into granting access
It drains battery faster
It logs them out of other devices
